boardgame.name: Beyond the Dungeon (Issue #3 - Summer 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome street wizards to the latest edition of Beyond the Dungeon. In this issue we explore the magical world around us: Urban Fantasy!

You'll find these articles:

Traits for and urban fantasy campaign
Random street gang generator
Random NPC secrets
Werewolves, vampires, and fey as compete factions or PCs
Smaller Godz– A urban mini-setting with gods of smells, clocks, or forgotten things.
Mizar System – A gritty space mini-setting
Extreme Babysitting – An adventure where heroes rescue a kidnapped fey child
Conquest of Castle Blud – A traditional fantasy adventure where the characters explore a ruined castle.

boardgame.name: Into the Arctic
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Perry Fehr returns to the Porphyra Roleplaying Game and the Lands of Porphyra Campaign Setting with a new sourcebook of arctic options. Within its pages you will find new and updated material on:


Races of the Snowy Lands: Iktaq, Pasakoyonai (human), Sikayan (human), Ith'n Ya'roo, Orcam, and Undine
Pantheon of the Snowy Lands: Anguta, Malina, Anningan, Sedna, and Tulok plus Ithaqua and Tsathoggua
Magic: New spells tied to the snowy pantheon and the Courage domain.
Occult Ritual: Ride of the Wind Walker (for those daring enough to ride with Ithaqua)
Archetypes of the Snowy Lands: Angakkuk (shaman) [cleric], Atanarjuat (fast runner) [fighter], Ice Cliff Walker [barbarian], Ice Trapper [rogue], Iglaak (traveling stranger) [Wizard], Kumaglak (camp leader) [Eldritch Knight], Throat Singer [bard]
Magic Items of the Snowy Lands: 9 wondrous items, 4 magic weapons
Feats of the Snowy Lands: 7 feats
Equipment of the Snowy Lands: 3 new items
Monsters of the Snowy Lands: 6 new monsters and several monsters updated from MoP1 and MoP2

boardgame.name: Bokkenrijders
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A ghastly creature streaks across the night sky, riding a fire-breathing demon goat and leaving behind the withered husk of a fresh kill. The citizens of Harbintown are beset by bandits, a ruthless lord, and the bokkenrijder. But something connects them all. Can a party of intrepid adventurers solve the mystery and save the village?

This Fifth Edition adventure is designed for three to six 5th - 7th level characters and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 6.

Includes 2 NEW MONSTERS!

Two years ago, a swindler named Crowder and his partner Inaayat came upon a riverside settlement named Harbintown. Crowder bore a remarkable resemblance to the local lord, Everton Harbin. They conspired to kill Harbin and take his place.

But things went wrong. They were discovered and eventually surrounded. Running out of options, Crowder took out the cursed idol he had stolen from his mentor and smashed it on the ground, even though he had no idea what it would do. A devil emerged from the smoke, riding on a giant, fire-breathing, fiendish goat. In desperation, Crowder made a deal with the creature. The lord’s mansion burned down, killing Everton, his family, and everyone inside it.

Crowder took Everton’s place, rebuilt the mansion (partially), and hired new guards, including a sassy, fast-talking rogue named Ramsey.

The devil’s influence began to change Crowder. He enacted brutal laws and levied punishing taxes. Many villagers were forced to leave and resorted to banditry in order to survive. In addition, the goat-riding devil killed villagers at regular intervals. That was the price to be paid. To protect his secret, Crowder blamed the bandits, claiming that they summoned the bokkenrijder from the depths of hell and unleashed it upon the populace. The common folk now toil and suffer under the ruthless rule of Crowder and the ever-present threat of the bokkenrijder...

Adventure Summary
This adventure is divided into three parts:

Part 1. The adventurers reach Harbintown, fighting off a gang of bandits on the way. At the local tavern, they are met by Inaayat and Ramsey. The bokkenrijder claims another victim as they speak. The adventurers are contracted by Crowder to find the bandits he says are responsible for the attack and eliminate them.

Part 2. It begins with a search for the bandit hideout. Once there, the adventurers discover that these are merely displaced villagers and have nothing to do with the bokkenrijder. However, Inaayat and Ramsey have been trailing the adventurers and show up behind them. The adventurers can try and convince the duo to spare the villagers or fight them to the death. They learn that Crowder isn’t who he claims to be and is definitely connected with the monster.

Part 3. The adventurers go to the manor to confront Crowder, where he has a surprise planned for them. The bokkenrijder shows up and attacks the adventurers. When they are at their weakest, Crowder joins in. Can the adventurers take down their combined forces? Or perhaps Crowder can yet be redeemed?

boardgame.name: Catacombs Generator
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This generator can be used to easily generate tentacular and unforgiving catacombs to explore and plunder, hack'n'slash style, not unlike in Diablo I.

The supplement contains:

A table of content
An how to
Lots of tables:
Corridors and rooms generation
Features
Hazards
Special rooms description

boardgame.name: Instant Drill
boardgame.description:
In this game of intelligent questioning and word hunt set in a military camp, players take on different roles of trainees, lieutenants and observers in a timed drill.

With different roles having different objectives, trainees hunt for a the code word, captain answers all monosyllabic questions, lieutenants guide the trainees and Observers hunt for the lieutenants.

Win the game as a trainee by getting the code word, win as an observer by getting a hold of the lieutenant and win as a lieutenant by staying hidden from the observer.

boardgame.name: Instant Sync
boardgame.description:
Can you tell what your friends are thinking or how they think?
In this fun game of synchronization and fun descriptions, telepathically connect with friends

On each turn, players choose game mode and try to synchronize in descriptions to score most points.
Players select two words(one from each card) comprising a modifier and an identifier and write secretly on their sync pads.
Once everyone is done announce and reveal choice of words then score points according to chosen mode.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Attack of the Intergalactic Gherkins!
boardgame.description:
Attack of the Intergalactic Gherkins is a whacky space-vegetable-themed card game.

Having been sucked through a black hole whilst escaping the terrifying Intergalactic Gherkins, the stranded astronauts must rebuild their ships and return home to their own galaxy.

Players draw cards to move around the four planets of the solar system, collecting missing ship parts and rebuilding their spaceships before escaping.

Opponents can play a variety of action card combinations in order to win, which can either help them or hinder opponents. These might include such cards as Meteor Showers (stops a player moving), Cosmic Ray (take a card from another player's hand) or stealing turns by combining cards to create word-matched 'Conjunctions' such as Pole + Star. Players must also deal with Gherkin Attacks which slow their progress. This could be by using cards such as Antimatter to make them disappear or a Rocket Pickle Jar to send them to another player to deal with.

Card drafting and hand management are crucial in this light-strategy game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dosdediez (N√∫mero 13 - Apr 2000)
boardgame.description:
Dosdediez
Número 13
Apr 2000

boardgame.name: War of the Sundered Realms
boardgame.description: War of the Sundered Realms is a fantasy miniatures wargame of mass battles for two players. Each player will choose an army to take to the battlefield and attempt to defeat their foe, either through bloody conquest, tactical mastery or both! All you’ll need to play is an army of miniatures, some eight sided dice (D8’s), activation counters, markers for tracking damage and something to measure with.

boardgame.name: Clone High
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Way, way back in the 1980s Secret government employees Dug up famous guys and ladies And made amusing genetic copies.

Now the clones are sexy teens now They’re gonna make it if they try Loving, learning, sharing, judging Time to laugh and shiver and Cry.

boardgame.name: Revolutionary Girl Utena
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Ohtori Academy, Jumper. This private boarding school in the heart of Japan, bearing both a Junior Academy and the main Academy, plays host to the scions of wealth and power, the prodigal talents that could define a generation, and amid the white spiraling architecture and rose motifes one can find an experience unlike any other a child or teenager could ask for.

boardgame.name: Spirit of the North
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The Northern Lights have fractured, become corrupted. Their once radiant light has been dyed a permanent red, and has become a choking poison to any life near it. What remains of human civilization in this area is little more than broken ruins and long dead skeletons. All that still lives here are the plants and flowers, as well as a few odd small animals. It is to this setting that a singular ordinary fox makes his way through the landscape. He will encounter the Guardian of the Northern Lights, a female fox spirit, who will bestow some of her power to him and allow him to journey across the land in order to fix the broken Northern Lights. You will be starting this jump around when the fox is walking through the frozen glacier, shortly before he met the spirit fox.

boardgame.name: Lords of Waterdeep: Moedas & Co. Metal Coins
boardgame.description:
This kit contains 60 coins:


50x 1 Toals coins, antique golden finish
10x 5 Harbor Moons coins, antique golden finish


Specification:


20mm and 30mm in diameter
8g unit weight
made of zamak alloy, resistant to bending, dents and corrosion

boardgame.name: Clans of Caledonia: Moedas & Co. Metal Coins
boardgame.description:
This kit contains 70 coins:


30x £1 coins, antiqued copper finish
20x £5 coins, antiqued silver finish
20x £10 coins, antiqued golden finish


Specification:


18mm, 22mm and 25mm in diameter
4g, 6g and 8g of unit weight respectively
made of zamak alloy, resistant to bending, dents and corrosion

boardgame.name: Odd Worlds: The Frog and the Scepter
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to an island in a far off land where the tyranny of Lord Kra-met has led characters to a showdown in an ancient temple. If they fail, the frog lord will summon a creature from another age capable of leveling rival cities.

This scenario is designed for handfuls of level 1 characters.

boardgame.name: Icebound
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Presenting the spiritual successor to the Perilous Vista series by Frog God Games, written by the same man who wrote that series! This is Icebound!

Contents
Icebound has new rules, equipment, weather charts, and hazards for running a campaign set in any polar biome! In addition to this, Icebound contains 22 new feats, 12 new monsters (one of which can be an animal companion), 34 new spells, 22 new archetypes, and 2 new adventures!

Summary
In most places, the rising and setting of the sun is a daily occurrence, an event signaling the dawn of a new day or the cessation of one’s labors. Daily routines are much different at the poles. Throughout winter and beyond the sun rarely, if ever, peeks above the horizon. Its absence casts the land into seemingly perpetual shadow, allowing frigid temperatures and brutal conditions to take hold. Animals retreat to their insulated dens or flee for warmer climes. Humanoids take shelter indoors, subsisting on the provisions they gathered during the spring and summer months. Even the monstrous denizens limit their exposure to the cruel elements, only venturing outdoors to stave off the pangs of hunger. Venturing out onto the desolate glaciers or navigating a route through the sea ice choking the polar seas bears the telltale hallmarks of an unrewarding fool’s errand doomed to end in disaster.

The poles consign the unprepared, the ill-equipped, and the unwary to an unmarked, snowy grave, leaving most to wonder why anyone in their right mind would dare venture into this forsaken wilderness. For those who dwell and travel here, the poles offer opportunity and a challenge. The bounties of the seas beckon fishermen and hunters to these chilly waters, while the allure of natural riches and lost civilizations buried beneath the snow inspire treasure seekers to trek inland. Surviving the frozen ordeal takes experience, careful planning, and some degree of luck. Although cold weather is an absolute certainty, nature has more tricks in its devious bag. Sheets of blinding ice and snow, ferocious winds, and gargantuan waves of dislodged snow and ice represent a meager sampling of the terrors awaiting polar explorers. If you have the courage to test your mettle and try your luck against winter’s wrath, be warned. At the poles, nature gladly takes prisoners, permanently encasing them in ice and snow. Watch every step, or find yourself forever icebound.

boardgame.name: Comeback Traits
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Comeback traits are a new category of traits that only trigger when you aren’t successful. They were created to alleviate the terrible feeling you get whenever the dice decide that nothing is going to go your way and are named after the feat Strong Comeback from Pathfinder Roleplaying Game Ultimate Combat. There is an exemplar comeback trait (the rules for exemplar traits are found in Pathfinder Player Companion Chronicle of Legends), but it is slightly different in intention when compared to the other comeback traits as I do not think extraordinary failure should be planned for that dramatically, but having a way to guarantee success is well worth it and fits the theme of bypassing bad luck.

boardgame.name: The Dark Den of Dagon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This adventure is designed for a group of 4-6 characters of levels 5-7 playing the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. While functional as a standalone module, this adventure is designed to be the first adventure in a series exploring the workings and reasons of a deity of the Lost Lands referred to as the Nameless One and her most faithful servant, “the Walking Stick Man” as they try to recover ancient words of power and stir forces lost and forgotten.
This adventure starts in the settlement of Chesmire, though can be moved around with little difficulty and placed in any campaign world with only minor changes, namely the addition or use of an ancient lost or near lost pantheon. The reason for the placement in this area is easy access to the adventure “Sorcerer’s Citadel” from Quests of Doom, which should be played following the events of the second adventure in this series as a return to the feelings of normalcy while still maintaining references to the ancient pantheon on which these adventures are focused via the statue of Mocham.

Adventure Summary

Long ago, the neolithic pantheon was the primary pantheon and Dagon was not yet a demon lord. This was a time of great power, when gods still spoke the Language Eternal freely and rewrote reality as they saw fit. Dagon had many coastal temples, such as this one, that over the millennia have sank beneath the surface taking their priesthood with them. As Dagon fell, so did the priests that still venerated him in these sunken temples. Those devout enough received blessings on sacred relics within the temples to adapt them to their new home. The blessing to do such at this temple was twofold as Dagon bestowed upon the Eye of Dagon, a 5,000 gp diamond that was kept on display in this temple, the ability for them to survive underwater and upon the temple walls itself he granted the power to SUSTAIN. The temple has been found a few times over the years, most notably by a Xill seeking a safe nest and a Xorn who arrived drawn to and seeking to devour the Eye of Dagon, but it has remained untouched by human hands since Dagon, and the temple, fell.
A few weeks ago, a shopkeeper named Tryn was expanding her underground storerooms on the edge of town and broke into this ancient temple beneath the town. The laborers she hired vanished with screams as the passage opened, leaving Tryn to report the incident to Elder l Sabratha who sent for adventurers from Port Manden and placed militia to prevent anyone or anything from entering or leaving the business.
After arriving in town, the characters are intercepted by an older man who appears blind with a walking stick before they get to Elder Sabratha. He requests they retrieve an ancient tablet from the dungeon that they are headed to and offers some odd items in return. Elder Sabratha arranges payment with the characters for clearing and securing the area but does not know the walking stick man if asked.
Inside the tunnels, warnings are scrawled on the walls despite no one entering. As the characters plunge farther in, they face off against aberrations and find objects unseen for centuries that are being activated in ways unused by modern society. Upon returning to the surface, the walking stick man is waiting in the house for them to retrieve the tablet and make good on his offers. The guards do not recall anyone entering other than the party if asked. Elder Sabratha is ready with payment in town and offers the party to stay the night with her to recover before setting out again. In the morning, Tryn offers a 10% discount on all items in her shop for the next week to the characters, if nothing was stolen from her of course.

boardgame.name: Magitech Expanded
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Magitech Expanded provides over 50 magic items of all rarities for your Atlantis Divided Campaign (though these items are easily usable in most settings). Items range from potions, traditional magic items, and orichalcum magitech for both above and below the surface.

Items include:


Override Shard. Insert it into a construct to charm it.
Depth Charge. A large are explosion that explodes 1 minute after the fuse is lit.
Gloves of the Mantis Shrip. Your punches deal greater damage and had a thunderous boom!
Wings of the Pelicari. It's not flying, but you sure can fall with style!

boardgame.name: Demon's Ex
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You hunted demons. Then you fell in love with one.

This is the first in a series of four player-character classes for use with 5E rules. The Demon’s Ex was a true hero: a capable warrior whose vocation in life was slaying demons. Their one mistake was having a heart susceptible to romance.

boardgame.name: Quick Jackfruit
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

You are a vessel. A hundred seeds sleep within you — a hundred trees, yet to be planted.

This is the second in a series of four player-character classes for use with 5E rules. (The other characters are the Demon’s Ex, Charm Addict, and Wise Serpent.) The Quick Jackfruit is a nascent forest. As they adventure, the party burgeons with their saplings — plant spirits with magic powers.

boardgame.name: Charm Addict
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Pearls of power in your biceps, spells of speed for your calves. Did you pierce your throat with steel reeds, so you would sound better?

This is the third in a series of four player-character classes for use with 5E rules. (Other characters are the Demon’s Ex, Quick Jackfruit, and Wise Serpent.) The Charm Addict is a body-mod enthusiast — obsessed with self-improvement via magic charms inserted into their skin.

boardgame.name: Wise Serpent
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What is the meaning of snake-hood? Is venom a necessary part of who you are? Life abroad will test your answers.

This is the fourth in a series of four player-character classes for use with 5E rules. (Other characters are the Demon’s Ex, Quick Jackfruit, and Charm Addict.) The Wise Serpent is an enormous cobra. As they adventure, they learn how to share their divinity with a disciple — a servitor under their spell.

boardgame.name: Tiny Epic Dinosaurs: Shipshape Gamer Insert
boardgame.description:
The Kickstarter for Gamelyn Games "Tiny Epic Dinosaurs" has certainly been Epic! Now that backers are receiving their games, it is time to get your Dino Ranch organized! Precision made and carefully crafted out of either Birch or Cherry plywood. Includes clear acrylic lids! The insert comes disassembled, but putting it together is quick and easy. No glue or special tools are required!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Tiny Epic Galaxies: Shipshape Gamer Organizer
boardgame.description:
Keep your game pieces for Tiny Epic Galaxies well-organized with this game box organizer from The Shipshape Gamer! Precision made and carefully crafted out of beautiful laser-cut Basswood or Clear Acrylic. The Basswood option is sanded and sealed/finished on all sides so it will look great for many years. The Box Organizer comes disassembled, but putting it together is quick and easy. No glue required!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Tiny Epic Galaxies: Beyond the Black ‚Äì Shipshape Gamer Organizer
boardgame.description:
Keep your game pieces for Tiny Epic Galaxies "Beyond The Black" well organized with this game box insert from The Shipshape Gamer! Precision made and carefully crafted out of beautiful laser-cut Basswood plywood or also Clear or Black Acrylic. The Basswood option is sanded and finished on all sides so it will look great for many years. The insert comes disassembled, but putting it together is quick and easy. No glue required!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Tiny Epic Galaxies: Beyond the Black

boardgame.name: Honey Buzz: Shipshape Gamer Organizer
boardgame.description:
This is a unique and precision-crafted insert set compatible with "Honey Buzz" by Elf Creek Games. This insert includes space for the Honey Buzz "Honey Pot" expansion!

Includes four player/meeple boxes that hold all of the pieces for each player. Makes setup a breeze! Also includes boxes for the honey, nectar, coins, player tiles... everything! Several of the boxes has a nicely detailed color lid to hold everything in place even when storing vertically!

The insert is made out of 1/8" Baltic Birch Plywood and is sanded on both sides. It comes flat packed and requires assembly, but it is quick and easy and does not require glue or any special tools. Click Here to learn more about the materials we use in this product.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: T√≠r na n√ìg
boardgame.description:
In the Irish myth cycles, the land of Tír na nÓg is the realm of the Otherworld, the place where the Fairies lived and heroes visited on quests. It was a place just outside the realm of man, off to the west, where there was no illness or death or time, but only happiness and beauty.

In Tír na nÓg, players will take on the role of storytellers, transported to the Otherworld against their will, and challenged to talk for their lives. Entertain the fairies and you'll return home. Fail to do so and you are trapped forever in Tír na nÓg.

Each round, players will lay claim to cards in a unique straddle draft, placing their custom marker across multiple cards. After all players have placed their markers, they will draft a card and play a card according to the tableau scoring cards.

At the end of 5 rounds, the player who has best pleased the Fairies will be release from Tír na nÓg.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Book of Random Tables: Ancient World
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

29 D100 Random Tables for Ancient Greece and Other Ancient Cultures

Find RPG tables like Items in a Temple, Items in a House, Ship's Cargo, and names fitting numerous ancient cultures.

boardgame.name: Legendary Sorcerers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There's Power in the Blood

Legendary Sorcerers is the latest volume in our series of class-focused player supplements, this time focused on those spellcasters gifted with magical power beyond their own comprehension. These mystical savants are arcane spellcasters, but the form of their magic is altered by the origin of their power. The legendary sorcerer is a fully redesigned version of the core caster class, with a unique class feature that grants spellcasting flexibility, makes cantrips more useful, and expands bloodlines to allow customization of your inherent powers rather than fixed advancement. No matter the quest, the legendary sorcerer is ready for adventure, with are 13 bloodlines, including the Aberrant Sorcerer, who mutates with each spell cast, the Draconic Sorcerer, who can exhale spells, the Elemental Sorcerer, who combines physical strength with the summoning of energy, and the Undead Sorcerer, whose magic curses those it touches. You’ll also find six spectacular archetypes like the arcane seeker, impulsive mage, and disciple of violence, alongside nearly two dozen sensational spells and feats perfect for unleashing your arcane power with fantastic flair.

boardgame.name: Age Of Civilization: Shipshape Gamer Insert
boardgame.description:
Now that the Kickstarter editions are reaching backers, it is time for a quality organizer/insert by The Shipshape Gamer to keep your game pieces well-organized! Precision made and carefully crafted out of attractive and durable draftboard (an engineered wood product) or Natural Birch Plywood. The Game insert comes disassembled, but putting it together is quick and easy. No glue or special tools required!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Age of Steam Deluxe: Shipshape Gamer Organizer
boardgame.description:
The Age of Steam Deluxe game by Eagle-Gryphon games was a great Kickstarter success story and many people are now enjoying their games with deluxe content. Now is the time though to get things organized and tidy!

This is a carefully crafted box insert/organizer for the game and helps organize all the game materials, including the Kickstarter stretch goal components! Includes organizer compartments for track tiles, coins and individual compartments for each of the player train sets. There is also a section to hold the extra round player markers that were replaced by the Train Meeple stretch goal. All compartments fit neatly in the box and hold the individual game boards snugly in place. Each main section has its own lid that keeps components from getting tossed about.

The organizer is made with 1/8" Birch Plywood. Click Here to learn more about the materials we use in this product.

Everything comes flat-packed and requires assembly. It’s fun and easy though and no glue is required. If you have any questions about any of these options, please don't hesitate to reach out to us!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Architects of the West Kingdom: Shipshape Gamer Organizer
boardgame.description:
Now you can keep all the components for Architects of the West Kingdom nice and tidy and ready to play! This organizer is filled with great features:

Designed to hold the base game as well as the expansion “Age of Artisans” all in the base game box.
Store horizontally or vertically while keeping all components organized.
Supports sleeved cards.
This is a carefully crafted game box insert/organizer for the game and helps organize all the game materials, for both storage and in-game play. Includes organizer compartments for all cards from both the base game AND the “Age of Artisans” expansion (yes, it supports sleeved cards!). There are also separate storage containers for each of the 6 players pieces (with clear acrylic lids) as well as storage for the various resources and coins. All components fit neatly in the box and hold the game boards and player cards snugly in place. There is no lid lift so the box closes completely. Each storage unit has its own cover that keeps components from getting tossed about whether the game is lying down or is up on its side.

The organizer components are constructed of an 1/8th inch thick engineered wood product called draftboard.

Everything comes flat-packed and requires assembly. It’s fun and easy though and no glue or special tools are required.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Architects of the West Kingdom: Age of Artisans

boardgame.name: Azul: Stained Glass of Sintra ‚Äì Custom Glass Tower
boardgame.description:
Great add-on to your Azul game! This is a replacement Glass Tower made out of beautiful etched clear acrylic. Easy to assemble and requires no glue or special tools.

— description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Open Ocean: Shipshape Gamer Insert
boardgame.description:
This is a beautifully crafted acrylic card deck box compatible with "Open Ocean" by Featherstone Games. This insert is designed to fit in the existing game box and holds the game cards.

The insert is made out of 1/8" clear acrylic. It comes flat packed and requires assembly, but it is quick and easy and does not require glue or any special tools.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Wallenstein: Shipshape Gamer Cube Tower
boardgame.description:
This is a beautifully crafted cube tower that can be used for the Wallenstein game by Queen Games. The tower is made of 1/16” Walnut or Cherry plywood.

Assembled, it matches the dimensions of the stock cardboard tower that comes with both games. The interior cube shelves are identical to those in the original and it is designed to fit inside the plastic funnel and base of course! It comes un-assembled but is easy and fun to put together with the enclosed instructions. It does not require glue but some may wish to give it a drop in a couple spots if desired.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Jurassic Parts: Shipshape Gamer Insert
boardgame.description:
This is a unique and precision crafted box insert set compatible with Jurassic Parts by 25th Century Games. This insert is designed to hold all the in game pieces and leave just the right amount of room for all the fossil tiles that comes with the Kickstarter release of the game.

The insert consists of two boxes that stack together (posts on the lower box anchor it to the upper one). The lower box holds the Resource Cards and KS field guide supplementary cards. The cards can be sleeved and there is plenty of room here! The upper box is divided down the middle... One half for the Amber pieces and the First Player Marker. The other half holds all the player chisels. The box is then capped off by a nicely engraved lid!

The insert is made out of 1/8" birch plywood that has been sanded on both sides. They come flat packed and require assembly, but it is quick and easy and does not require glue or any special tools.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Oath: Chronicles of Empire and Exile ‚Äì Shipshape Gamer Insert
boardgame.description:
This is a unique and precision-crafted insert set compatible with "Oath" by Leder Games. This insert is designed to fit in the storage wells of the existing plastic insert that comes in the game.

Includes five player/meeple boxes that hold all of the pieces for each player. Makes setup a breeze! Each of these boxes has a nicely detailed lid for each box. The images are laser-engraved, but also have a white film left behind during the laser process. You can leave that film on (as shown in these pictures) or remove it entirely and just have clear engrave images on each lid. Your choice!

Also includes a larger box for the Chancellor pieces and a smaller box to hold the miscellaneous pieces from the game. All boxes have acrylic lids so you can store your game vertically if you choose!

The insert is made out of either 1/8" Birch Plywood or 1/8" Draftboard (similar to MDF). The draftboard option protective tape on both sides (protects from laser smoke damage) that will need to be peeled off prior to assembly. They come flat packed and require assembly, but it is quick and easy and does not require glue or any special tools.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Oath: Chronicles of Empire and Exile

boardgame.name: Pacific Rails, Inc.: Shipshape Gamer Insert
boardgame.description:
This is a unique and precision crafted organizer compatible with "Pacific Rails, Inc." by Vesuvius Media. This organizer is designed to support vertical storage as each box/tray has its own lid, keeping all the components neat and well organized. It is also designed with enough room to hold the upgraded components available during the Kickstarter campaign!

Includes four player/meeple boxes that hold all of the pieces for each player. Makes setup a breeze! Each of these boxes has dividers allowing for easy organization of each players components.

Also includes a storage box for the various resources used in the game. This box has convenient sloped interior ramps that makes it super easy to grab components quickly.

And finally, a central storage box for all the track tiles, Specialist tokens, scoring goals, and carriage upgrades.

The insert is made out of 1/8" birch plywood that has been sanded on both sides. They come flat packed and require assembly, but it is quick and easy and does not require glue or any special tools.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Pendulum: Shipshape Gamer Insert
boardgame.description:
This is a unique and precision crafted insert set compatible with "Pendulum" by Stonemaier Games. This insert is designed to fit in the storage wells of the existing plastic insert that comes in the game.

Includes five player/meeple boxes that hold all of the pieces for each player. Makes setup a breeze! Each of these boxes has a divider down the middle so the resource cubes can go on one side, and all the player-specific bits can go on the other side. Also included is a nicely detailed lid for each box. Note that in the images above, I colored in the meeple images on the lids, but I don't do the coloring in the shipping product. I will leave that to you if you want it! I used colored markers, but colored pencils would work just as well!

Also includes a box for the center section that holds all the Vote tokens. This box also includes a nice box lid so you can store your game vertically if you choose!

The insert is made out of 1/8" birch plywood that has been sanded on both sides. They come flat packed and require assembly, but it is quick and easy and does not require glue or any special tools.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Small Samurai Empires: Shipshape Gamer Insert
boardgame.description:
This is a beautifully crafted storage insert compatible with "Small Samurai Empires" by Archona Games. This insert is designed to fit in the game box and provides plenty of room for all game components including upgraded components that were included as part of the Kickstarter pledges.

Includes four player boxes that hold all of the pieces for each player. Makes setup a breeze! Each of these boxes has a divider down the middle so the order tokens can go on one side, and the samurai/castle pieces can go on the other side. These boxes also have a sloping "ramp" on each side making removal of pieces during game play a breeze! Each box has a nicely detailed.

Also includes a box for the food/bushido tokens, as well as a box for the variant components. All boxes include lids so you can store your game vertically if you choose!

The insert is made out of 1/8" birch plywood that has been sanded on both sides. They come flat packed and require assembly, but it is quick and easy and does not require glue or any special tools.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Tiny Epic Pirates: Shipshape Gamer Insert
boardgame.description:
Avast Ye' Scallywags! The Kickstarter for Gamelyn Games "Tiny Epic Pirates" has definitely been Epic! Now that backers are receiving their games, what are you going to do to get all those pieces organized! Look no farther... The Deluxe "Pirates Cove" insert will keep all your loot shipshape! Precision made and carefully crafted out 1/16th" birch plywood, and includes beautiful lids illustrating a treasure map!

But there is more!

Has space for the "Curse of Amdiak" and "Crimson Silver" expansions all in the one main Tiny Epic Pirates box!
Beautifully illustrated lids for the component boxes... Store your game horizontally or vertically!
Four separate player boxes... makes setup a breeze!
Enough room for the upgraded "Skull Dice"
The insert is made out of 1/16" Birch Plywood and does not require glue or special tools to assemble. The insert comes disassembled, but putting it together is quick and easy.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Tiny Epic Pirates: Crimson Silver mini expansion
Tiny Epic Pirates: Curse of Amdiak

boardgame.name: Lost Ruins of Arnak: Shipshape Gamer Organizer
boardgame.description:
This is an officially-licensed insert designed for "Lost Ruins of Arnak" by Czech Games Edition.

Includes beautifully detailed storage containers for the card decks (supports sleeved cards), Guardian & Site tiles, and individual component boxes for all the game pieces. Each of the token/marker boxes includes a nicely etched acrylic lid to keep all pieces organized and in their place... Story your game vertically, or if shake it like crazy! Everything stays securely in place. Each box was designed to be removed and placed on the in game locations (supply board, player boards, etc). Makes setup a breeze!

The insert is made out of 1/8" Baltic Birch Plywood and is sanded on both sides. It comes flat packed and requires assembly, but it is quick and easy and does not require glue or any special tools.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Glass Road: Shipshape Gamer Organizer
boardgame.description:
Now is the time to get things organized and tidy with your Glass Road game! This is a carefully crafted box insert/organizer for the game and helps organize all the game materials, for both storage and in-game play.

Includes organizer compartments for player tokens and cards, as well as all the separate tile sets. All compartments fit neatly in the box and hold the individual game boards snugly in place. Each main section has its own lid that keeps components from getting tossed about.

The organizer comes in 3 materials to fit your budget:

Draftboard - This is an 1/8th inch thick engineered wood product for the budget conscious. It has an external feel like paper but is rigid and durable. Because it does not have a sealer coat on it, it may over time pick up marks from normally handling. If that doesn't bother you, you can certainly leave it like that, or you can put a light clear-coat finish over it after it has been assembled. This material is shipped with a protective film on both sides which serves to protect the surface from smoke damage from the laser as well as to protect it from marks during shipping. I personally feel this is the material that provides the best balance between cost and quality.

Birch Plywood - Also a budget option, this is made out of 1/8" plywood. I lightly sand before cutting with the laser. It will not have protective tape applied, so you will see some smoke marks on the edges as a result of the laser cutting process. Some people like this look, but if not, these marks can be reduced or eliminated with light sanding prior to or after assembly.

Sanded and Finished Basswood Plywood - This is a premium material. It is sanded and finished on both sides and protected during lasering with protective tape on both sides (so no smoke marks). The end result will be a beautiful, sanded and sealed product that will last for many years and still look like new! This material is more expensive to obtain hence the higher cost for choosing an organizer insert made from this.

Everything comes flat-packed and requires assembly. It’s fun and easy though and no glue is required.

—description from the publisher

Includes organizer compartments for tiles, resources, coins & victory points, as well as individual compartments for each of the player meeple sets. And to round things out there is the "sporran" divided compartment for what is left over!

All compartments fit neatly in the box and hold the individual Chronicles boxes snugly in place. Each main section has its own lid that keeps components from getting tossed about.

The organizer comes in 3 materials to fit your budget:

Draftboard - This is an 1/8th inch thick engineered wood product for the budget conscious. It has an external feel like paper but is rigid and durable. I personally feel this is the material that provides the best balance between cost and quality.

Birch Plywood - Also a budget option, this is made out of 1/8" plywood. I lightly sand before cutting with the laser. It will not have protective tape applied, so you will see some smoke marks on the edges as a result of the laser cutting process. Some people like this look, but if not, these marks can be reduced or eliminated with light sanding prior to or after assembly.

Sanded and Finished Basswood Plywood - This is a premium material. It is sanded and finished on both sides and protected during lasering with protective tape on both sides (so no smoke marks). The end result will be a beautiful, sanded and sealed product that will last for many years and still look like new! This material is much more expensive to obtain hence the higher cost for choosing an organizer insert made from this.

Everything comes flat-packed and requires assembly. It’s fun and easy though and no glue is required.

boardgame.description:
Keep your game pieces for "Tiny Epic Tactics" well-organized with this game box organizer from The Shipshape Gamer! boardgame.name: Tiny Epic Western: Shipshape Gamer Organizer
boardgame.description:
Saddle Up Pardner! Tiny Epic Western is too fun of a game for your darn pieces scatter'n all around in the box! This here game box organizer from The Shipshape Gamer will keep everything where it is supposed to be! Precision made and carefully crafted out of beautiful laser-cut Basswood or in Clear Acrylic. boardgame.name: Viticulture: Shipshape Gamer Organizer
boardgame.description:
Need a storage solution for your Viticulture game? But what if you want a quality organizer AND want to store your game on the shelf vertically? Look no farther! The Shipshape Gamer has you covered...

Designed to hold base "Viticulture Essential Edition" game components as well as the "Tuscany Essential Edition" expansion! *
Store horizontally or vertically while keeping all components neat and tidy.
Supports upgraded components (coins, player pieces etc)
Supports sleeved cards

The organizer does have room for the additional cards supplied in the other two expansions ("Visit from the Rhine Valley" and "Moor Visitors Expansion") but not all of the small cards will fit if they are all sleeved.


This is a carefully crafted box insert/organizer for the game and helps organize all the game materials, for both storage and in-game play. Includes organizer compartments for the small cards (yes, it supports sleeved cards!), as well as a covered deck box for the larger cards. Also has separate storage containers for each player's pieces, and another for miscellaneous game components. All components fit neatly in the box on top of or below the game boards. Each storage unit has its own cover that keeps components from getting tossed about whether the game is lying down or up on its side. The various boxes are also spacious enough to handle upgraded components for player pieces and metal coins.

The organizer is available in either Birch Plywood or as an engineered wood product called Draftboard. Click Here to learn more about the materials we use in this product. The covers on the player boxes is made from clear acrylic.

Everything comes flat-packed and requires assembly. All the sheets are covered with a protective film that will need to be removed as well. The assembly is fun and easy and no glue or special tools are required.

Note that there have been several versions of the Viticulture game released. This organizer is specifically designed for the current "Viticulture Essential Edition" and "Tuscany Essential Edition". I cannot guarantee its fit with any other boxed versions or components.

— description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Viticulture: Visit from the Rhine Valley

boardgame.name: Wingspan: Shipshape Gamer Owl Player Markers
boardgame.description:
This is a set of beautifully engraved wood player markers that can be used as replacements for the action cubes in the Wingspan game by Stonemaier Games.

Each set has 40 pieces... 5 different Owl designs, and 8 of each design. Each design comes engraved on a different wood, including Cherry, Hickory, Walnut, Maple, Basswood, Poplar, Red Oak, and others! All pieces are 1/8" (3mm) thick. The engraved image is on both sides of the pieces!

At this time, the selections of wood varieties in an order will be randomly determined. However, if you have particular requirements here, please shoot us an email at info@shipshapegamer.com and we will see if we can fulfill special requests.

— description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Tapestry: Shipshape Gamer Insert
boardgame.description:
First up is the player box inserts/trays. There are 5 of them and each holds all the necessary pieces for each players setup, They are designed so the plastic insert that comes with the game fits down over these trays. They are made of Draftboard (an engineered wood product - It has an external feel like paper but is as rigid and durable as wood) with Acrylic lids to keep pieces from flying about. The acrylic lids are laser engraved with an architecture/building motif. The pieces come with protective tape on both side. This serves to protect the surface from smoke damage from the laser as well as to protect it from marks during shipping.

— description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Terraforming Mars: Shipshape Gamer Player Mat Overlay
boardgame.description:
This is a carefully crafted player mat overlay for use with Terraforming Mars by Stronghold Games. If you hate it when the table gets bumped and your pieces go flying, then here is the answer!

Each order includes 5 overlays in the chosen material. You can choose from 4 different materials...

- Draftboard (engineered wood product)
- Clear Acrylic
- Basswood Plywood
- Walnut Plywood

The Basswood and Walnut options are sanded and sealed with a nice clear finish to protect from fingerprints, spills, etc.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The River: Shipshape Gamer Insert
boardgame.description:
“The River” by Days of Wonder is one of those few games that has a great insert, but the meeples and resources still get relegated to ziplock bags! Here is a great solution to keep those pieces organized!

This organizer by The Shipshape Gamer fits nicely down into the main recessed area of the existing insert. The slide-on lid clicks into place allowing you to store your game vertically without pieces flying everywhere! Precision made and carefully crafted out of attractive and durable draftboard (an engineered wood product).

— description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Tiny Towns: Shipshape Gamer Insert

Comes in 2 material variations... Birch Plywood and Draftboard. Click Here to learn more about the materials we use in this product.

boardgame.description:
In Viscounts of the West Kingdom: Gates of Gold, people from near and far have come to see the splendor of our great city. While most are traders and labourers, eager to make a home for themselves, others seem to have more devious intentions. Can we really trust those who once attacked our walls? Do they truly desire peace? The King has sent his orders, but we will decide who may stay and who must go.

This expansion introduces the new King's Order and Outsider Cards, new Building Bonus Cards, Manuscript Boards, and plenty of new Townsfolk, Heroes and Manuscripts Tiles.

boardgame.name: 18BE Railways in the Coal Dust
boardgame.description:
18BE is a one-to-five Players complex economic board game openly inspired by the share-trading and railroad operating 18xx games series originated by Francis Tresham and Leonhard Orgler.

Belgium, 19th Century. The air is thick, charged with coal particles. The land is dark, muddy. Coal Mines spread everywhere. Yet people are starving. The Belgian industrial revolution is in motion and Belgian Railways Companies are about to emerge.

Players act as investors in the emerging Belgian Railway Companies. Their largest shareholder is the Director, and he alone takes decisions for the company. Players will spend their starting funds to either launch, promote, upgrade, operate, or develop their companies in an effort to accumulate the greatest wealth in cash at game end. To achieve their goal, players may also invest in companies shares, speculating on future returns and market values.
18BE introduces a 3D map board with overlays and unique features to ensure each session delivers their very own challenges. Companies may purchase different types of trains, invest in different trade opportunities (the so-called "Links") and/or Upgrades. Thus each company will most probably be played in a totally different way from one session to the next. Experienced gamers should be able to play the game in less than 6 hours. The rules also include a solo mode, and a challenging 2-Player mode.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: ThreeTale
boardgame.description:
Three–¢ale is a cooperative adventure game for 3 players who choose their fairytale heroes with stories going way back. Each hero has their asymmetric talents. The gameplay’s a combination of variable player powers in the form of virtues, strategic tile placement and a little bit of dice rolling.

As a team, the tree players go through four phases – Prophecy Phase, Past, Present, and Future.

In the Prophecy phase, three scenarios of future doom are mystically revealed, holding hints to help the players draft their heroes. In the Past phase, every hero gets the chance to develop their stats and talents to be mighty enough to save the world from eternal doom. The heroes’ miniatures move through the tile-built board, thus collecting Virtues, Shevitsa and Speed cubes. They also enter Battles, complete Quests and collect Treasures and Artifacts by drawing cards.

Upon completing the Past Phase, the heroes enter the Present, where it is revealed which of the three prophecies will be fulfilled. Then, the Future comes, knocking on the door. Each Future has its own backstory, inhabitants and win condition. What will it take to save the world? Will you battle a mighty enemy, will you aim to gather lots of precious recourses, or will you simply fight for your own survival? Come and see for yourselves…

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Pirate Party: Women of the High Seas
boardgame.description:
A competitive card game for 1-4 players ages 14+. Easy to learn and 20 minutes to play. 

Players race to collect sets of cards featuring vibrant, diverse, historical women pirate captains with special powers. Plunder, pillage, and raid from other players to take the largest pirate booty. Includes period ships, mermaid wild cards and a Kraken Attack.

How to Play:

Players start with eight cards each and the remaining deck forms the draw pile.

A turn consists of playing sets face up on the table. A set can be suited with at least three cards that must include a captain, crew, and a ship or another card in the suit. Then use the special power of the captain to plunder cards from other players. A set can be 3-of-a-kind such as 3 birds or 3 maps or 3 treasure chests. Match cards to sets of other players by suit or kind. Adventure cards keep the competition for pirate points lively. Mermaid is a wild card. Draw a card when you are done playing any sets, matches, or adventure cards then the turn is over.

Game play moves to the next player. All cards played score pirate points at the end of the game. The player with the most points wins.

Bonus 1-player Seaport Solitaire games included!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Melty Blood Type Lumina
boardgame.description:
"MELTY BLOOD" is reborn.

“MELTY BLOOD” is a series of 2D fighting games based on TYPE-MOON's visual romance novel "Tsukihime." Since the game's original release on PC in 2002, it has also had a number of ports for arcade, PlayStation®2, and Steam.
Now, at long last, the “MELTY BLOOD” series is making its way to PlayStation®4, Nintendo Switch™, Xbox One, and Steam on September 30, 2021 in the form of "MELTY BLOOD: TYPE LUMINA".

A brand new battle involving familiar Tsukihime characters.

Based on the story from "Tsukihime -A piece of blue glass moon-" for the PlayStation®4 and Nintendo Switch™, this new game features a cast of over 10 characters with upgraded visuals as well as HD environments befitting a new "Tsukihime" title. The battle system has also been rebuilt from the ground up for a more modern feel.
Fans of the "Tsukihime" series will have the chance to enjoy their favorite special attacks and battles in the form of a 2D character fighting game.

Stylish and dynamic with easy controls.

The battle system has been rebuilt from the ground up, but still retains that “MELTY BLOOD” spirit.
This new system employs combination attacks that can easily be performed through repeated button pressing, allowing players who may be less familiar with fighting games to enjoy exhilarating battles.
However, the essence of the previous games has been preserved, so long-time fans can still enjoy their favorite parts of the series with an updated system and all-new action.
Experience deeper gameplay and more intense battles in this rebirth of a classic.

Source: The Game Website.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
2021 The Game Awards Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Architects of the West Kingdom: Crossover Promo Pack
boardgame.description:
The 'Crossover Promo Pack' is a set of 14 promo cards requiring both expansions from Architects to function - Age of Artisans and Works of Wonder.

Note: These are included inside every copy of the Collector's Box. There will be a limited number available without the Collector's box from the publisher in 2022.

—description from the publisher

Craft Card 1 Adornment = Gain a Tool
Craft Card 1 Tool = Lose 1 Influence to gain 1 Virtue

Craft Card 2 Adornment = Gain a Reward Card
Craft Card 2 Tool = Gain 1 Influence

Craft Card 3 Adornment = Gain 3 Influence
Craft Card 3 Tool = Lose 2 Silver to gain 1 Virtue

Craft Card 4 Adornment = Gain 2 Debts
Craft Card 4Tool = Gain 1 Influence

Archive = Gain 1 Influence per Adornment or Tool (sum of both)
Almshouse = Lose 2 Influence to gain an Apprentice or Tool
Vineyard = Gain 3 VP per Adorned Wonder

Strongman 1 = Gain an Adornment during each Black Market Reset where your Artisan is at the Princess's location (before the Princess moves)
Strongman 2 = You may make a contribution when placing your Artisan at the Profiteer's location
Strongman 3 = Gain 1 Stone and 1 Wood when placing your Artisan at the Princess or Profiteer's location

Traveller 1 = Gain 1 Influence and 1 Silver when gaining an Apprentice or Tool
Traveller 2 = Gain 1 Influence and 1 Silver when gaining an Apprentice or Adornment
Traveller 3 = Gain 1 Influence and 1 Silver when gaining an Adornment or Tool

boardgame.name: Coal & Guns!: British ships 1885 ‚Äì 1905
boardgame.description:
This volume contains “ship cards” for the rule set Coal & Guns!. In order to play with them you need the basic rulebook.

Coal & Guns! is a three-dimensional tactical naval wargame for the era of the so-called "Pre-Dreadnought".

Above all, it wants to be a very simple and fast way to arrange on the table some models of those picturesque ships that marked the transition period between sailing ships and warships as we know them today.

It was a short period of only a few tens of years, between the end of the 19th century and the very first years of the 20th century (conventionally from 1880 to 1905), but which, from a technical point of view, was literally upset by new inventions or applications that followed one another at a frenzied pace.

The intensive use of steam energy, the construction of increasingly efficient breech-loading guns, the production of enhanced explosives, the invention of the electric motor and the radio, the use of torpedoes, the continuous development of steel armor and aiming devices are just incredible examples of applied technology that changed the way of waging war at sea in those few years.

The shipbuilding industry, of course, had to keep up and in less than half a century they passed from sailing ships to battleships, through a series of intermediate stages that made the obsolescence of the projects very rapid.

All this caused the flourishing of projects among the most imaginative and disparate that have ever been seen, with ships that were a synthesis, with different shades, between the pomp and romanticism of sailing ships and the solid reality of steel, the dirt of coal and the cold effectiveness of modern technologies.

Those vessels, especially in the bright pre-war colors, with white or black hulls, wooden decks, light or ocher superstructures, bright yellow chimneys, red or green keels, gold finishes, were a triumph of Art Nouveau style applied to instruments of death, often destined to be torn apart by the cannon fire of opponents who are perhaps less attentive to aesthetics but with the most advanced technology.

From a wargame point of view, playing with these ships is very interesting, because they are often very different from each other and because, despite being equipped with powerful guns, they did not fight at unimaginable distances on the gaming table.

The individual ships of the different nations, even within the same fleet and the same category, have great differences between them in terms of armament and armor, so the game can become quite varied and exciting.

Here, on a 180 x 120 cm table you can use models in 1: 2400 or 1: 1500 scale, in order to allow a good representation of the ships involved.

Coal & Guns! is very simple and intuitive and the heart of the system lies in the “status” cards of the ships.

Drawing free inspiration from the very nice Brigade Models steampunk rules Imperial Skies, we tried to create a very linear and pleasant game system, but with rational mechanisms that, even in a few rules, aim to give you the flavor of that way of fighting.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Coal & Guns!: Tactical level naval rules for the pre-dreadnought era

boardgame.name: Encounters along the Long Road
boardgame.description:
"Make travel along the largest trade route of the North more exciting this expansion for Storm King's Thunder!
Encounters along the long Road is an excerpt from Veratrem's Tribal Siege, an adventure that takes place during Chapter 3 of Storm King's Thunder.

The adventure is designed for the Storm King's Thunder campaign and is intended to give your players extra content during Chapter 3.
It will bring your party to Wealdham, a small town located in the Westwood.
There, they will face off with Veratrem, a young green dragon that has taken control of a local kobold tribe.
If the adventurers think they can easily take the weak creatures, they have a surprise coming to them...

In this free supplement, you can find 8 new encounters that can happen to adventurers traveling along the Long Road.
The encounters are tailored to Storm King's Thunder, but work well in any Forgotten Realms campaign (or, with a little more work, any campaign!)."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: „Åè„Åø„Åì „Å® „Åã„Å§„Å≤„Åï (Kumiko and Katsuhisa)
boardgame.description:
„Åè„Åø„Åì „Å® „Åã„Å§„Å≤„Åï (Kumiko and Katsuhisa) is a trick-taking game for two players. One player takes on the role of Katsuhisa, a businessman who grew a large company, and his daughter, Kumiko, whom he left the management decisions to when he grew older. However, Kumiko thought her father's ideas were not for the modern times and changed many company policies, which made Katsuhisa furious. Through their roles and Chairman and President, the two set the stage for a proxy fight at the next shareholders' meeting.

The game takes place over several rounds as each player tries to woo the shareholder for the round, such as the institutional investors or the employee stock ownership plan, over to their side.

Each shareholder to be courted presents a number of shares (victory points) and some conditions for the current round, such as determining the trump suit. In addition to the cards for playing the tricks, each player has a hand of "Proposal Cards" which represent the policy proposal they are using to win the shareholder's votes, and these have game effects, such as reversing the ranks of cards or making certain suits worth negative points.

After a volley of proposals, the two players complete a series of tricks and evaluate who earned more points in the current round. The winner collects the shareholder and their votes, represented by their number of shares. The player with the most votes at the end of the game wins.

boardgame.name: Legends of Crimson Bluff
boardgame.description:
The Legends of Crimson Bluff is an deck-destruction fighting game that puts players as actors in the roles of rival gunfighters, gamblers and outlaws in the American Old West. Each has a unique deck of cards representing their skills, signature moves, etc. Cards are multi-purpose, so players must decide the best use for each situation.

Players collectively select a scene before each game. Scene decks can be team-based struggles or free-for-all brawls, and cards add additional props, minor characters, rules and objectives.

As gunfighters take wounds, they lose cards from their decks until they become stricken. Stricken gunfighters continue to fight, but can be ignored as a target by other players. Be the player or team to fulfill the scene objective to win!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Blood Reef: Tarawa ‚Äì Gamers Guide
boardgame.description: This is a magazine-style supplement for ASL Historical Module 5 that includes historical background, tactics articles, official rules Q&A for that module, and example play-throughs.

boardgame.name: Tukdatu: Wer √ºberlebt den Dschungel?
boardgame.description:
Tukdatu is a funny and gripping card game in which the players use clever tactics to collect treasures and fight dangerous creatures. The opponents slip into the role of tourist Tiffany, adventurer Banana Bones or researcher Prof. Dr. Whity. Only those who have enough equipment or who get off in time will survive the expedition.

In this exciting and funny card game, the players become part of this extraordinary group. Only a few items of equipment and the special abilities of the individual characters are available for fighting dangerous living beings. Only those who plan cleverly or get out in good time have a chance of surviving the expedition and collecting treasures on top of that.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: ASL Comp Afrikakorps: Operation Torch
boardgame.description: ASL conversion of an expansion pack for Advanced Tobruk covering the desert war in October 1941. Adds 8 scenarios. Comes in a ziploc bag.

boardgame.name: Racing Ogres
boardgame.description:
Racing Ogres is a fast paced game of bluff and prediction for all ages. Up to eight players receive their very own deck of Ogre Cards. Each round, players will simultaneously select an Ogre from their deck to enter the race. Each Ogre has it's own speed and limit. The speed will determine how far down the race track you travel, and the limit is a restriction of how many of that type of Ogre is allowed at one time.

Will you risk playing a faster Ogre with a small limit, or will you play it safe and creep along the racetrack slowly.

There is also a pile of Training Cards available for a 'take that' element to give players the edge.

By far the best part of this game is the simultaneous decision and turns. The game does not slow down with bigger numbers and can play up to eight players easily.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: ASL Comp Afrikakorps: Bitter Enders
boardgame.description: ASL conversion of an expansion pack for Advanced Tobruk covering the desert war in October 1942. Adds 8 scenarios. Comes in a ziploc bag.

boardgame.name: Once upon a time in Chicago
–û–¥–Ω–∞–∂–¥—ã –≤ –ß–∏–∫–∞–≥–æ
boardgame.description:
You will find yourself in the role of journalist John Fitzpatrick, in the cycle of events taking place in Chicago in 1929, when the "dry law" has not yet been repealed and the Great Depression has not yet begun.

In a city where gangsters and bootleggers are often more powerful than politicians, and where corruption and smuggling flourish, young journalist Fitzpatrick makes a name for himself by investigating the underpinnings of apparently unremarkable crimes. Only logic and flair can help you. Ambiguous clues, vague hints, encrypted messages, random phrases, and sometimes blatant lies - all this will come across you during your investigation and will give you the key to exposing the villains.

You have to plunge into the world of robberies and murders, get to the bottom of the truth in four main and one secret mission, each of which has its own plot (partly related to other missions), a unique set of characters and evidence. More than 50 unique locations are waiting for you, where you will visit during the game. For example, the Great Leader barbershop, the University of Chicago, the Chattanooga Arms weapons store and even Madame Zhu-Zhu's cheerful salon

boardgame.description:
This scenario pack is a reprint pack of favorite scenarios previously featured in the Schwerpunkt magazine, with each one designed by Pete Shelling. The scenarios have been renumbered with the Rally Point numbering scheme.

Scenarios:

Most of the scenarios were designed by Evan Sherry but Mike Augustine provides two of the ten.

boardgame.name: Furnace
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A representative of the Wiklev Federation hires the travelers for a delicate mission. A factory on the Jorum Family world of Obkaddo needs to be destroyed. The Jorum Family is building up weapons with the intent to begin open war in the Bernescale sub-sector. A stealthy infiltration of the factory is required. But all is not as it seems about this mission.

boardgame.name: Paladins of the West Kingdom: BGInserts "Car Safe" Insert
boardgame.description: 3D printed insert for Paladins of the West Kingdom.

boardgame.name: Shark Room
boardgame.description:
Shark Room is a competitive card game for 2-4 players that simulates the dynamics of aggressive trading in the stock market.
The players buy and sell financial shares, sometimes illegally, trying to secure their earnings and giving their opponents an hard time by playing Shark Cards.
The one who makes the biggest money wins.

Players draw 3 Shark cards, that allow them to bend the market or bother other players, then they put on the market new shares on sell. Buying and selling shares increase or decrease their price, and manipulating it is part of the game. The shares also give their owners dividends if owned in a certain number, and the players can also buy Asset cards to secure their money and to gain various benefits.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Unmasqued
boardgame.description:
Unmasqued is a game of deduction and patterns. The player moves the Detective around the ballroom to find pairs of cards that score the most Rumor Points. Throughout the game, Rumor Points can be turned in for Clues, allowing the player to narrow in on the identity of each culprit. The player wins the game by confronting both culprits before the end of the third hour.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Avocado Smash: Party Edition
boardgame.description:
Avocado Smash is back -- and ready to party! The smash hit snap card game from Ridley's Games has gotten even more smashing in this jumbo Party Edition.

You ordered it and we've served a brunchier take on the original by adding Avocado Toast to the gameplay! Packed with lots more cards and fresh rules, with each smash a player wins on a card that features toppings, they get to add that tasty topping like a fried egg or tomato to their Avocado Toast token. The goal is to have the most toppings on your Avocado Toast when the game ends! But watch out for the You're Toast card! Everything comes packaged in an extra-large avocado container wearing a fun party hat.

Perfect for avocado lovers and families, this game is suitable for ages 6+, 2 to 8 players and has an average of 20 minutes gameplay.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Disco Balls
boardgame.description:
Put on your dancing shoes! It's time to put your moves to the test with this funky card game of hilarious missteps from Ridley's Games! When the 'DJ' shouts Disc-go!, each player simultaneously plays the top card from their hand, and when a matching pair is revealed, make sure you're the first to bust the right move! The player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner (and dancing queen!).

Whether you're channeling your Travolta vibes, sinking to the floor doing the Swim, or getting on down with one of the other moves, this is a dance party that will keep you on your toes and that's fun for the whole family! All of the dance cards are dynamically illustrated with vibrant neon colors and come packaged in a groovy disco ball tin!

Perfect for families and groups of friends, Disco Balls is suitable for ages 8+, 3 to 6 players, and has an average of 15 minutes gameplay.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Munchkin Farkle
boardgame.description:
Play the classic game of Farkle in a whole new way!

Munchkin Farkle marries the classic dice game with the Munchkin sense of humor and stab-your-buddy mentality. Rather than the traditional race to win, Munchkin Farkle is a race to win...while making your companions lose!

Cheat, curse your friends, and occasionally run away as you push your luck on every roll. Add the most gold pieces to your hoard and win!
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for Munchkin Farkle

listing.notes: Title: Munchkin Farkle Publisher: Steve Jackson Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: List or Twist
boardgame.description:
You'll need to think quickly in List or Twist, the category-guessing game from Ridley's Games where the answers are only as easy as the clues! In this fast-paced game, players split into two teams and take it in turns to try to guess what's listed on the card by the clues made up by a player on their team. They then switch things up and play off against each other, with things coming to a head during a bonus round! Each time a clue is offered, the team can either List by requesting another clue, or Twist by guessing the answer! But don't ask for too many clues or guess incorrectly, as each time you do you lose points!

With categories ranging from TV and places to technology and pop culture, there's something for everyone.

Perfect to play with family or a group of friends, the game is suitable for ages 8+, 4 to 10 players and has an average 30 minutes gameplay.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Playmobil: Brandweer
boardgame.description:
This is a simpler version of Playmobil: Alarm! Alarm!, as players only try to play their own hand, not hindering other players in any way. Another difference is that players only play a single card, rather than three.

Included in Playmobil set 5495 (Adventskalender Brandweer met kaartspel).

boardgame.name: Love to Hate
boardgame.description:
Warning: this game may stoke divisions! In Love to Hate from Ridley's Games, you'll find out just how well you actually know your friends & family. And the player who knows the others the best wins.

On a scale from Love to Hate, can you guess what your boyfriend thinks about pineapple on pizza or clowns? How about your sister's feelings about ABBA or being tickled? Find out in this hilarious party game filled with highly divisive subject cards!

Featuring topics and themes including pop culture, pet peeves, and people, players will take turns picking a card while the others guess how that player feels about it using voting cards. With the feelings ranging from 'Love' and 'Like' to 'Ehhh', 'Nope,' and 'Hate', each round will sure to be a conversation starter!

Perfect to play with family or a group of friends, the game is suitable for ages 8+, 3 to 8 players and has an average 20 minutes gameplay.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Fat Cats
boardgame.description:
Tricks win the treats in this a-meows-ing strategy card game Fat Cats from Ridley's Games. Are you the talented tabby that will win the most treats?

You and your fellow felines have two rounds to win after starting off with nine trick cards for nine chances to win the most treats and be the ultimate fat cat. Each trick and treat card has a points value, and players must play cards like strut, pounce, and a cat-tastic performance along with other tricks to try to win treat cards like a chin scratch, milk and a tasty fishy!

Purrrfect for cat lovers, this game is suitable for ages 6+, 2 to 5 players, and has an average gameplay of 15 minutes.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Seas of Havoc
boardgame.description:
In Seas of Havoc, players take on the role of a unique captain of a ship in a naval combat game where players are competing for the most renown. Players can gain renown for discovering shipwreck and battling it out on the high seas.

The game is split between a combat phase on the high seas and an island phase where players send out their skiffs to worker placements to gain resources, improve their decks, repair and upgrade their ship. During the combat phase, Players will play out a hand of cards to maneuver their ship; navigating obstacles, searching shipwrecks and firing cannons at their opponents. Multi-use cards offer options as the battle unfolds and card bonuses reward smart play.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: G.I. JOE Deck-Building Game
boardgame.description:
In G.I. JOE Deck-Building Game, you and your fellow players will lead teams of G.I. JOE soldiers on missions to stop Cobra's dastardly plans! Each player starts the game with a meager deck that will grow more powerful as you recruit veterans from the G.I. JOE team, requisition gear, and field new vehicles. This fully co-operative game pits you against increasingly dangerous missions to save the world. This core set begins your journey with everything needed to play, but be prepared for more JOEs and missions to come!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Fire-Water-Wood
boardgame.description:
This is a simple little card game combining Rock-Paper-Scissors and War that you can play anywhere. All of the game pieces are held in your hands so you can play Fire-Water-Wood while waiting in line, riding in the car, walking from place to place, and so on.

The object of the game is to collect all of the cards.

Players start with one of each card type shuffled and hidden. On each turn the top card is turned over and the action resolved. This continues until one player runs out of cards.

boardgame.name: Zombie Chase
boardgame.description:
Perfect for beginners and pros alike, Zombie Chase is a great choice for the next family game night! Set at Lake Nomby amusement park, everyone was having a wonderful time until the sun began to set and an ominous crash is heard at the center of the park. From within the dark and creepy park maintenance shed, a moaning sound emerges. The owner of that sound quickly becomes clear as the Zombie Janitor appears and begins his search for brains! In a panic, the park guests and security flee the park and lock the gate behind them to keep the zombie trapped inside. The problem is the janitor isn’t the only one left behind! YOU’RE trapped too!

Players roll two Dice. Move your Character the number of spaces shown on the white die, then move the Janitor Zombie the number of spaces shown on the green die. Your goal is to find a flashlight by landing on and flipping the item tiles. Once you have found a Flashlight, go to the maintenance shed, grab a Key, and proceed to any exit to escape the park!

Watch out for Zombies though. If you end up on the same space as a Zombie, flip your pawn over, and now you become a Zombie and your strategy changes. Now your goal is to chase the other Human Characters and turn them into Zombies!

There’s two ways to win Zombie Chase! Find a flashlight, grab a key from the maintenance shed, and be the first to escape through one of the gates or you can win by being the one to infect the final human player as a Zombie. With two ways to win, everyone has a shot at coming out the winner and every playthrough is a new adventure. One thing is for sure: to win at Lake Nomby amusement park, alive or undead, you’ll be needing plenty of brains!

—description from the publisher
