boardgame.name: Tomb of the Viper Prince
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Tomb of the Viper Prince is a Fifth Edition adventure intended for three to five characters of 6th to 8th level and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 7. Characters who complete this adventure should earn enough experience to reach one-third of the way to 8th level. The desert tomb of an ancient and powerful prince has been uncovered, and a powerful artifact lies hidden within. This adventure takes place in the Freelands campaign setting but fits into any existing campaign with a desert in which a hidden tomb can be placed with only a few modifications.

This one-shot adventure is designed to easily be dropped into any existing campaign with just a few location name changes!

This Adventure Includes:

13 Page Full-Color Illustrated PDF
3 Hi-Res Digital Map Files of the Tomb and Desert Encounter
New Creature Stat Block: Ur Atum, the Viper Prince
New Magic Item: Crown of Serpents

boardgame.name: Knight of the Vampire
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Knight of the Vampire is a Fifth Edition adventure intended for three to five characters of 2nd to 4th level and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 3. A knight turned vampire spawn has returned to his ancestral home to watch over his grown children. After being forced to kill a local townsman, his presence has been revealed, and now adventurers have been asked to hunt down the monster terrorizing their town. This adventure takes place in the Freelands campaign setting but fits into any existing campaign with a town near a forest with only a few modifications.

This one-shot mystery adventure is designed to easily be dropped into any existing campaign with just a few location name changes!

boardgame.name: Wrath of the Banshee Queen
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wrath of the Banshee Queen is a Fifth Edition adventure intended for three to five characters of 9th to 11th level and is optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 10. A banshee queen holds a court of trapped spirits prisoner within her cursed castle deep in the swamps. The adventurers will be drawn into the spirits' horror-filled ghost stories, battle the enchanted furniture gone mad, and discover the truth behind the banshee queen's curse.

This adventure takes place in The DM Tool Chest's Bastion domain of dread setting that easily fits into any existing campaign. You can also easily change the names of the people and locations to place the adventure location into any setting that includes a ruined castle in a swamp.

boardgame.name: The Death Herd
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Death Herd is a Fifth Edition adventure intended for three to five characters of 2nd to 4th level and optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 3. A local rancher is frantically looking for his herd of cows that went missing during the night. His prize cow Bessy was among them, and the annual festival to the gods is next week. The herd’s tracks are easy to follow and lead to the entrance of an ancient shrine. Inside, the adventurers must overcome deadly traps, puzzles, and ancient guardians. Eventually, they must face the true villain: Bessy the Death Cow. This adventure takes place in the Freelands campaign setting but fits into any existing campaign with only a few modifications and name changes.

boardgame.name: The Frost King
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Frost King is a Fifth Edition adventure intended for three to five characters of 1st to 3rd level and optimized for four characters with an average party level (APL) of 2. A goblin tribe stumbled across an ancient tomb holding an evil spirit known as the Frost King. Now the land is gripped by a wintery curse, threatening the nearby town of Myrefall and the surrounding lands. With the help of an eccentric young goblin, the adventurers must brave the frozen warrens and confront the Frost King to end his icy reign.

This one-shot adventure is designed to easily be dropped into any existing campaign with just a few location name changes!

boardgame.name: Assault on Fort Despair
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Assault on Fort Despair is an adventure made for a party of three to five adventurers of 2nd to 4th level; it’s optimized for four adventurers with an average party level (APL) of 3. The adventurers should reach level 4 at the completion of the story. It’s been written using the Freelands campaign setting but is designed to fit into any setting with only minor changes. Feel free to use the content as-is or plug-and-play with it in your own campaign! You have ultimate control of how this story will be played out so, as always, have fun with it!

In 19 pages of action-packed content, art, and battlemaps, the final chapter in the Rise of the Black Skull trilogy has the adventurers making their way to an island fortress controlled by the Black Skull Brotherhood. They're building an undead army and need to be stopped before reaching Hopewell Harbor. With the help of the crew of the Surprise, they must battle their way over the sea and take down the necromancers.

boardgame.name: Im Flug durch die Welt
boardgame.description:
The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 58 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Imigrantes
boardgame.description:
Imigrantes is a worker placement and set collection game that takes place in Brazil, at the end of XIX century, when millions of immigrants coming mostly from Europe and Asia arrived in the country, looking for better opportunities and a wealthier life, but then facing a very different reality.

During the game, you hire immigrants, produce and sell coffee beans and industrial products, earn money and invest it to expand your territories, but never forget to get involved into the politics to get some favors and deal with some eccentric events on Brazilian history. Whoever develop better their domains and collect the best combination of immigrants wins the game.

The game is heavily based on Brazilian history, the % of immigrants is, as much as possible, near to what really happened and all in game events really happened. They were adjusted only to make sense as a game.

boardgame.name: Sometimes They Come Back
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the small village of Narmaren, passing travelers, residents and even animals have been reported missing. Who (or what) is behind these disappearances? Dare you attempt to learn the truth?

This 24-page adventure (for 1st level characters) was written by industry award-winning authors Jolly R. Blackburn and Brian Jelke, with Barbara Blackburn, and includes all the maps, useful background, artwork and adventure details you need; with no useless padding! Like all Kenzer and Company products, this adventure was designed with the GameMaster in mind. We prepare all the details so you can spend less time flipping pages and more time gaming. Being a GM has never been so easy, or so much fun!

For 1st level characters.

boardgame.name: The Hungry Undead
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

BLOOD, INSANITY, AND ANCIENT EVIL…

A strange rock formation, a treasure-laden tomb, and an insane man with wild ravings about the "Lords of Blood." What does it all mean? Do these "Lords of Blood" really exist? Will the Young Kingdoms fall before them? Or do you dare attempt to drive them back to whence they came...? If so, you must prepare yourself, my friend. This is not a place for the meek spirited or the wuss of heart. This is the HackMaster™ role-playing game.

This 16-page adventure (for levels 3-5) was written by industry award-winning author Jolly R. Blackburn, and includes full color maps, useful background, artwork and adventure details; no useless fluff! Like all Kenzer and Company products, this adventure was designed with the GameMaster in mind. We prepare all the details so you can spend less time flipping pages and more time gaming. Being a GM has never been so easy, or so much fun!

For characters of 3rd to 5th level.

boardgame.name: House of Madness
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A BIRTHING PLACE FOR EVIL...

A child of magic-users, experiments gone wild, and a strange building at the center of rumor and mystery. Are the rumors true - does the building really breed evil? Or is there more to its story than meets the eye? Do you dare brave its doors and see what lurks within...? If so, you must prepare yourself, my friend. This is not a place for the meek spirited or the wuss of heart. This is the HackMaster™ 4th edition role-playing game.

This 23-page adventure was written by veteran HackMaster author Charles Brown, and includes maps, useful background, artwork and adventure details; no useless fluff! Like all Kenzer and Company products, this adventure was designed with the GameMaster in mind. We prepare all the details so you can spend less time flipping pages and more time gaming. Being a GM has never been so easy, or so much fun!

This adventure was designed for the World of Aldrazar, a world where men are real men, women are real women, and magic and monsters are as real as your current routine of breakfast cereal and ham sandwiches. However, it also includes details on placing it within the Kingdoms of Kalamar - a realistic, dynamic world where complex political alliances mix with marauding bands of humanoids, and medieval technology and culture come faces to face with magic and the fantastic.

For characters of 1st to 2nd level.

boardgame.name: Temple of the Bronze Flame
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

During a religious festival, a manipulative cult steals a magical creature from the sacred garden of an honorable priesthood. Knowing that powerful magic must be at work, the priests have decided to look for outside help. Dare you brave the Temple of the Bronze Flame?

This 26-page adventure (for levels 3-6) includes all the maps, useful background, artwork and adventure details you need; with no useless padding! Like all Kenzer and Company products, this adventure was designed with the GameMaster in mind. We prepare all the details so you can spend less time flipping pages and more time gaming. Being a GM has never been so easy, or so much fun!

For characters of 3rd to 6th level.

boardgame.name: The Xorb

The Xorbe are created by famed Bionecrologist Benneputril Xorbe in her factory's growth vats, located somewhere in Wastland's hilly swampland somewhere East of Schleswig. There she conjures all manner of affronts to Science and Magic alike. Little else if known of the odious Benneputril and she intends to keep it that way. Repulsive though they may be, these sage like blasphemies are as intelligent as any woman, and wiser than any man.

boardgame.name: Don't Look Back: The Gourd Reaper Expansion
boardgame.description:
Pumpkin Head's name was said three times, in three different mirrors, in three different houses on All Hallows Eve. It's now bound to this neighborhood. Now you have to destroy his soul pumpkins before his grim harvest continues.

—description from the publisher

This expansion adds 1 Gourd Reaper Killer miniature, 4 Pumpkin Marker miniatures, and 1 custom scenario to the base game.

boardgame.name: Universalis - Dawn of Worlds
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Universalis — Dawn of Worlds ist inspiriert vom Spiel Dawn of Worlds. Als ich das Regelwerk gelesen habe, sprang mir sofort Universalis in den Sinn. Schon im normalen Spielmodus eignet sich Universalis hervorragend, um Spielwelten zu generieren.

Um das noch einen Schritt weiter zu treiben und ein möglichst simples wie effektives Regelwerk zu erhalten, habe ich versucht eine Anpassung von Universalis speziell auf Welterschaffung zu ormulieren. Dabei werden einige Konzepte aus Dawn of Worlds nicht explizit aufgegriffen. Sie sind ohne Weiteres realisierbar, aber nicht verpflichtend.

boardgame.name: Down & Across
boardgame.description:
The game of quick-thinking wordplay presented by Will Shortz, NPR's puzzlemaster and crossword editor of the New York Times.

Down & Across is a fast, competitive word game. Draw your letter tiles, roll the clue dice, and be the first person to come up with a two-word crossword to fit the clues!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Cursed Captains of Cthulhu Quickstart Guide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A swashbuckling tabletop roleplaying pitting your pirate crew against the eldritch forces of Cthulhu in the Golden Age of Piracy.
...
Play Cursed Captains of Cthulhu and sail your ship to glory. Hire your crew of miscreants, ne'er-do-wells, and seadogs, and take to the Caribbean sea to fight for freedom, plunder, and against the insidious mythos forces at play.

Cursed Captains of Cthulhu is a brand new setting and tabletop roleplaying game set in the golden age of piracy that pits your crew against the eldritch forces of the Cthulhu Mythos.

boardgame.description:
Horrified: American Monsters is a standalone game that features gameplay similar to 2019's Horrified, which challenges players to overcome the "Universal Monsters" from classic films.

In this co-operative game, you face off against classic American nightmarish beasts: Bigfoot, Mothman, the Jersey Devil, the Chupacabra, the Banshee of the Badlands, and the Ozark Howler. The more creatures in the game, the harder the challenge, with players needing to use their unique powers to figure out how to defeat each monster.

boardgame.name: Ragnarocks: The Winds of Chaos Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Winds of Chaos Expansion adds 9 new Mythology cards with some super fun powers supported by the extra components included, adding even more variability to your game sessions!

The 2 Custom Dice will be used to randomly determine a direction for you to make additional moves, summon additional runestones, or manipulate your opponents depending on the Mythology card you are using.

The 6 Viking Cards included will allow you to select a specific figure on the board in secret to receive a bonus or hindrance at the end of the game - again based on the Mythology cards in play.

And the 10 adorable Mountain Minis pair with other Mythology cards to allow for extra movement or even stand in as a strong and immovable Viking!

boardgame.name: Iconoclash: Cross-Dimension Zero
boardgame.description:
Iconoclash: Cross-Dimension Zero features 2 new crossover fighters for the Iconoclash system from Zephyr Workshop and Solis Studio.


Diane: Lead a team of combining robots! When she combines them against her foes, she draws from a special deck of extra powerful A.E.G.I.S. class robot attacks. It is a one-two punch of pure mechanized power.
Mr. F: Rushdown opponents and use extra movement tokens to power up his attacks. Mr. F's roots will then take hold and lockdown his opponents, preventing their escape. With Mr. F on the field there is no chance of escape!


In Cross-Dimension Zero you’ll take the fight to the universe-bending Dimensional Forest.

boardgame.name: Tricktakers
boardgame.description:
Tricktakers is a...trick-taking game featuring role selection. After being dealt a hand of cards, the players choose from various characters (such as King or Gambler) that change how they will participate in the game.

The basic game consists of three rounds of trick-taking, and the winner will be the person that wins the most tricks in two of the three rounds. Alternatively, if no one achieves that condition, if a player has taken no tricks in all three rounds, they will be the winner.

Not mentioned above, the game also has a higher priority victory condition and a lower one. Each character in the game grants the player holding it a special "immediate victory" condition that could be achieved. The characters also give the players ways to earn points, and this is the lowest tier of victory determination: who has the most points.

To illustrate some of the character abilities, the Gambler can discard cards from the initial hand to draw replacements, and will bid for how many tricks they take, possibly granting them extra points if successful. The Resistance has the potential to cause a "revolution" which reverses the strength of the ranks, and earns more points if they can win tricks with what would normally be the "high" cards.

boardgame.name: Zigfrak
boardgame.description:
Zigfrak is a space-based action RPG, featuring missions, exploration, and crafting. With an emphasis on loot and over-the-top items, it's not a traditional space sim. Enemy ships explode like loot piñatas, spewing forth useful pickups.

The game employs subtle humor to poke light at a dark situation -- a human civil war on a galactic scale, complicated by the invasion of technologically superior aliens. During the campaign, players encounter clues and artifacts which could reveal ancient secrets of humanity.

Source: [Steam Description].

boardgame.name: Through the Veil: Treasures of the Feywild
boardgame.description:
From the Publisher:

Journey through the veil and discover the treasure that awaits you in the Feywild. Do you dare wield such wild magic?

Treasures of the Feywild is the second volume in the Through the Veil series designed for Dungeons & Dragons 5th Edition (D&D5e). These pages hold a treasure trove of wildly original fey-themed items, artifacts, weapons, armor, potions, instruments, whimsical trinkets, and adventuring gear to delight, bewitch, and terrify your players!

A map that leads to your greatest desire...

Seven faerie dragons, trapped in stone by a spiteful fey prince...

A cloak infused with the very essence of the seasons...

A legendary blade that can control, even part, the sea...

Extensive lore to plant seeds of adventures beyond any hero’s wildest imagination.

Snag a seat at the Symphony of Seasons. Traverse the wind on a passing dandelion pod. Get lost in Alabast Pergolast's magnificent snow globe and an alpine village from which you might never escape. Sample fairy oddities like enchanted smelling salts, fairy ring soup, pixie dust, and more! Enjoy a cup of crinklecusp bud tea - with permission from the local dryads, of course!

Treasures of the Feywild features 170+ pages of items steeped in lore highlighting the mystery and magic of the fey realm: a legendary seed which can restore the dead to life; a mantle that manifests a liminal version of its wearer; a locket that transforms mortal injuries into butterflies. Adventurers beware such nefarious creations as the headband of nightmares, bone needles of Dread Polly Mudmouth, apples of dark slumber, and more.

Create compelling fey-themed adventures and campaigns around such legendary items as the Primal Vestments, Armaments of the Great Horned Owl, the masks of the Starlight Masquerade, the Stinging Garments of Whelve-La, and the Horn & Shield of Eponatha - the first unicorn, who sprang from the dream of a young girl known only as the Dreamcaller. And only a chosen champion may hold the Spirit of the Feywild itself in their hand.

boardgame.name: bit Dungeon III
boardgame.description:
Third installment in the series.

User Summary

boardgame.name: My First La Cucaracha
boardgame.description:
Help Mom Cucaracha feed her little ones. When you manage to deliver all the food balls first, you win.

Being a mother is a full-time job, especially for a Mama Bug with 3,589 children who are always hungry! Mama Bug races through the pantry doing her best to push as many crumbs as she can through the holes in the floorboards. Help Mama Bug feed her babies! The player whose food crumbs are gobbled up first wins!

A game in the Cucaracha game line from Ravensburger for the youngest children.

How to play:
Each player puts one of their crumbs onto the start space. Then the youngest player switches on Mama Bug and puts her on her start space, facing the direction of the arrow. Mama Bug will race through the pantry, pushing as many crumbs through the holes in the floor as she can. Sometimes this is easy, but other times she might miss! Did your crumb get pushed through a hole? Quickly put another of your crumbs on the start space. The first player to have all four of their food crumbs pushed through the floorboard wins.

boardgame.name: Cremona: Echo of Violins
boardgame.description:
The player takes on the role of the luthier boy and in the game he will have to go around the shops of the great Cremonese masters: Amati, Guarneri del Gesù, Ruggeri and Bergonzi. In these workshops he will have to collect the materials to build his own instruments: violins, violas and cellos, and learn the secrets of their workmanship. Going in this way by exclusion, he will have to understand the secret of Stradivari's workshop, which obviously changes with every game.

Objective of the game
The winner of the game is the one who, at the end of the game, has scored more points than is opponents. The point are obtained by making violins (each instrument has a number at the bottom right that represents its value), correctly revealing the secret of Stradivarius (3 points) and going to the Theater.
Each player must in their turn move his meeple to a tile adjacent to the one in which he is. Movement is mandatory. Once the player has entered the new tile, he must choose one of the following actions:

Benefit from one of the blocks that the tile offers
Build an instrument, but only if it belongs to the same family as the workshop in which it is located, and then look at the relative secret of the hidden family, without showing it to the other player
Reveal the secret of Stradivari (only if the player is in Stradivari’s workshop and only if he has built at least 3 instruments)


Once the chosen action is complete, the player ends the turn and it’s up to the next player.

The game continues in this way until a player builds six instruments, at which point the round of turns ends and the game ends whit the calculation of scores.

—user summary

boardgame.name: OMG: Das Partyspiel f√ºr Furchtlose.
boardgame.description:
OMG is a card based party game.

Your dice roll dictates, which task you have to fulfil. There are four different card types: Action, Question, Favor or Teamwork.

If the task is too hard/awkward for you, you can buy yourself out by drinking as many sips of your drink, as the card indicates. The the more uncomfortable the task, the higher is the price!

boardgame.name: mini-halma
boardgame.description: Halma game with significantly reduced playing fields and therefore also only for 2 players.

boardgame.name: One More Drink
boardgame.description:
“Come on, just one drink…” we know that sentence well and how it can lead you to having the best night with adult drinking games or drinking card games : OMD will help you enjoy game night games for groups adult in the best possible way :)

One More Drink is an adult games for game night drinking that even the “cleverest” of your friends will be able to play: : pick a card, read it, and do what it says. Drink games at their easiest.

Our interesting mix of cards will quickly make you forget other drunk games with boring cards and forced laughter : with "One More Drink" the drink game, your evenings will be filled with voting, activities, shots to take (and give!), and most importantly, real laughter with every card!

Play for fun or give the "Action" cards to the winner of the round, the winner is the one with the most cards at the end of the game (if still standing).

boardgame.name: Family Boom
boardgame.description:
Family Boom is a groundbreaking new card game that combines several activities into one small box! You’ll never be bored with the variety of different challenges and prompts.

Everyone can play Family Boom! The rules are simple: draw a card, read it, and follow the directions. All generations, young and old, will want to play this kids card game!

Sore losers stay away! Anything is fair in Family Boom board games...as long as it stays friendly enough. Cheaters will have to take the consequences, but only if they get caught!

—description from the publisher

Players participate in different challenges, presented on cards. The winner of the challenge keeps the card. At the end of the game, the player with the most cards wins the game.

boardgame.name: Together
boardgame.description:
A conversation starter game that will help couples discuss together !

This couple card games is designed to be an awesome conversation starter dating card game for adults to have various fun or deep topics around family, yourself, the future, dating, or bed : the conversation cards for couples will help both of you open yourselves up and deepen your relationship

Listening, talking, and debating are key for couples, our 3 cards categories trigger these essential skills: draw a card from the deck and answer the question yourself, ask the question for your partner to answer or answer together for deep and meaningful conversations

Play for fun or each round give the cards away if the player has answered successfully: The winner is the one who knows his beloved best and has the most cards!

boardgame.name: Girls Fever
boardgame.description:
This party game for girls night out has 6 fun categories to make confessions and hysterical laughter inevitable: Have You Ever, Vote, List, The Most Likely To, Would You Rather, Dare. Nobody can slip through the net of this girl talk game: so it's time to confess, and have a great time :)

Each card will get awarded to a player; at the end of the game, the player with who gained the most cards, wins the game.

boardgame.name: Der Zeitlift der G√∂tter
boardgame.description:
In this dice game, the 3 players take on the characters of Pacifist, General and Manager. Their task is to collect as many symbols belonging to their character as possible on a circuit in a predetermined time. Through various events you gain symbols or can also lose them. If you are in the time lift, you may be forced to swap your character with that of a fellow player. The winner is the player who has collected the most matching symbols after the set time.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Jagt die Rohrteufel
boardgame.description:
Players roll their game piece through a house, from the basement to the roof. On the way lurk event fields, where you collect chips, or can be thrown back. Whoever uses the right chip can prevent the throw back. The player to reach the finish line exactly, wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Rubbish Race
boardgame.description:
Did you know that the environment is Yellow, Blue, Brown, Green and Grey? These five colours are the ones that keep the planet clean and, taking advantage of our local festivities, we are going to celebrate the already traditional colour test that our participants have been preparing for quite some time in which they must be the fastest in recycling objects. Will you win the test this year? Show it by remembering the five colours of the environment and what we deposit in each one of them...
you should extract one of the cards with rubbish, then the first player to take the correct container win the card.
The player who gets 10 cards it's the winner, but pay attention, due if you take the wrong container, then you lose one of your cards.
It's made with FSC wood and recycled paper.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Burning Bakery
boardgame.description:
Marcelo, our town’s baker, has lost his 5 senses and can’t go on making bread. Shall we help Marcelo to recover his....

Sight, so the bread doesn’t burn?
Touch, to knead the bread and make it spongey?
Smell, so the bread’s aroma can tell him that it’s ready?
Taste, so the bread is neither very salty nor very sweet?
Hearing, so he can hear the oven’s bell on time?


It's a cooperation game where all the players should help Marcelo to recover their senses, for that, the players should take from the bag some of the wooden pieces with the different senses and then match with one of the cards which you can perceive with the sense you took from the bag, if it match, you win the sense, if not, you put the sense on the bag again. But if you take from the bag the flame, then the bread start to burn in the oven, if you take the flame 5 times before you recover the 5 senses, then all the players lose, otherwise win.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The King Is Dead: Betray Promo Card
The King is Dead: Traici√≥n Carta Promo
Der K√∂nig ist tot: Verrat Promokarte
boardgame.description:
Promo card for The King is Dead (Second Edition) sent out to Spieleschmiede backers.

Card text: Swap a follower in your court with a follower in any region.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The King Is Dead: Second Edition

listing.notes:
This listing is for a single card for use with the board game The King is Dead.
The card text reads: "Swap a follower in your court with a follower in any region"
"The Betray card can only be used in the advanced game. To use the Betray card, shuffle it in the with the cunning cards during setup. The Betray card can be played like any other card. When you do, swap a follower in any region of the board. You may swap followers of the same faction. You cannot swap a follower in the supply. Then summon a follower to court as normal."
New! Unused Shipping and BGG Fees $5

boardgame.name: Radical Pursuit
boardgame.description:
Questions that burn under the nails of each and every leftist: What did Marx mean by fetishism? Who was Rubinstein - Freud's pet name for his beloved, a pendulum often used in hypnotherapy, or rather a Soviet psychologist? Did the localists in the 19th century labor movement want their own independent party locality, was it about local autonomy or was it after all about a local united front?
With 62 question cards including answers, the time between demonstrations can be passed in no time and people will have fun doing it. Every shared flat will be able to collectively raise itself to a high level of knowledge. Suitable also for the beginning of studies and as a source of nasty questions for/to the professor or student.

—description from the publisher

In this game you are confronted with questions about leftist theory. Play Radical Pursuit cooperative and correctly solve the question as collective or do it in a competitive mode, collecting as much of your correctly answered questions that no one else could answer to win the game. In competitive mode you sure could also team up... it's up to you, what you make out of this game!

boardgame.name: Dungeoneers: Companions
boardgame.description:
This expansion allows you to hire mercenaries to follow you on your quest. When playing solo, this will make the game faster since there is less to keep track of than with complete heroes and the mercenaries fights in a similar way as the enemies. There are 15 named characters with there own story to choose from and an unlimited amount of generic characters from all professions.

You can also choose from 3 different breeds of dogs to accompany you. Your canine friend will evolve with experience and learn new abilities just like your hero.

Finally, there are 10 different types of familiars for your wizard to acquire, each with it's own benefit. As you fight together the bond between you and your familiar will strengthen and increase your effectiveness.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Suburbia + Inc.
boardgame.description:
The game Suburbia was published together with the add-on Suburbia Inc. in one box in 2013 by Russian publisher Crowd Games.

Suburbia is a tile-laying game in which each player tries to build up an economic engine and infrastructure that will be initially self-sufficient, and eventually become both profitable and encourage population growth. As your town grows, you'll modify both your income and your reputation. As your income increases, you'll have more cash on hand to purchase better and more valuable buildings, such as an international airport or a high-rise office building. As your reputation increases, you'll gain more and more population — and the player with the largest population at the end of the game wins.

During each game, players compete for several unique goals that offer an additional population boost — and the buildings available in each game vary, so you'll never play the same game twice!

The add-on expands the game with new tiles of the boundaries of the playing field, which bring bonuses to the owner. The expansion includes over a dozen new building tiles, as well as new income-boosting bonuses and reputation-raising tasks when completing intermediate in-game objectives.

The game is designed for 1-4 players over the age of 8. The duration is about 1.5 hours.

boardgame.name: Dispatches from the Raven Crowking V.7: Talking Primarily to Players
Talking Primarily to Players
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Daniel J. Bishop has written volumes of advice to help GMs make the most of their games.

But GMs are only half the equation. What does it take to take to be a good player?
This time out, the author looks at exactly that question. Why should you trust your GM? What can you do to make the game better for everyone involved? How is the game different for the players and the GM?
Herein is an examination of how traditional role-playing games work, a guide to successful play, and an option for playing Dungeon Crawl Classics with a small group of players. This is something every prospective judge should read, and the pdf is priced to make sure that the judge can share it with their players!
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Trail of Madness
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A jungle adventure for four 5th-level characters!

“Trail of Madness” is a short adventure designed for four characters of 5th level set in any region featuring forests or jungles. Characters of higher or lower levels can accomplish this quest with clever tactics or with additional dangers added by the DM.

boardgame.name: The Lighthouse
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

The first sign of civilization seen by so many early visitors to Ikstvarr was the lighthouse. Not just any lighthouse—for now this coast is blessed with several — but the lighthouse. Built by Baron Vodom before there was even a town on this island, it once guided ships around the storm-wracked southwest corner to safety in the port of Keelhafen. But its history is also steeped in blood. The memories of those who were there have made their way into the realm of nightmares, and from there they return to this Earth in a shape that
kills.

Baron Vodom’s lighthouse no longer stands, but the atrocities committed in and around it have given shape to a new
lighthouse. Memories of flayed human skin draped across the tower’s walls and severed limbs hanging from its windows provide it shape and structure. Memories of alarms, of screaming human voices, give it voice and it asks why—“why did you bring me to this island, only to suffer?” — as if it expects an answer from humanity. But it does not. It cares not for answers. Its goal is only the suffering that will give it more memories to use as nightmare fuel.

boardgame.name: Combo Pool
boardgame.description:
Here is Combo Pool, a game made using Pico 8, and winning entry to p8jam2. It's a game where you throw colored marbles against each other. If two marbles of the same color make contact, they merge and upgrade to the next color. Your lifebar diminish with the number of balls on the field. If you lifebar is empty, you enter in a sudden death mode, and your last ball must save you by removing some balls.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Save Koch
boardgame.description:
You are local mafia kingpin, Jeffrey Koch. Your empire in New Kandinski is in total chaos because an unknown Mastermind has decided to take your place. And they’ve planted a sleeper Mole inside your operation. It’s time to act, but you need to act smart.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Grow Big (or Go Home)
boardgame.description:
Play as Bruce, the world's most talented indoor gardener, in this 2D pixel-art puzzle game. Through now 30+ fast-paced levels, you will travel to different locations and eras in order to water, light, and tend to plants with the high-tech magic of a watering can and a reflective mirror.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Ghost Story Dice
Magische Geschichten W√ºrfel: Gespenster
boardgame.description:
Revive the art of storytelling using these nine beautifully illustrated wooden dice to create ghostly stories.

Construct your own spooky adventure tale with an array of creepy characters such as vampires, headless horsemen and decapitated knights. You can use your cloak of invisibility to escape from the dungeon in the haunted house, but beware of the creaking staircase! Once you’ve made it out, will your getaway car break down in the spooky forest under a full moon…?

This is the perfect family game that will stimulate the imaginations of children and adults alike. Ideal for playing by a log fire. But beware: this box glows in the dark!

boardgame.name: Bakken Bears Basketball: The Card Game
boardgame.description:
In Bakken Bears Basketball: The Card Game you take on the role of a basketball team, trying to outsmart your opponent buy playing different cards.

Every player has different abilities like blocking, scoring, stealing etc. and its up to you to combine those strengths to leave the court as the winner.

A player wins the match, if he reaches 10 points or if his opponent fouled 4 times.

On a turn each player has two actions. Those can be drawing a card, or playing one as for one of its abilities. To score a player has to combine certain cards. Before attempting a 2p or 3p shot, he has to play an assist card first. After an attempt a players needs to block or rebound.

boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game ‚Äì Captains Promo Set
boardgame.description:
This Box contains two alternate sculpts for the "Assault Veteran" (Lannister Faction) and the "Sworn Sword Captain" (Stark Faction) and their corresponding Attachment Cards.

Both sculpts were Kickstarter Exclusive.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game ‚Äì Stark vs Lannister Starter Set

boardgame.name: 2G2BT
Too Good to Be True Playtest
boardgame.description:
Mercenary mecha combat in a gritty future. A quick-play RPG for one-shots and short campaigns.

User note: Inspired by The Regiment. As of last post by the designer about the game on October 21, 2018, still in development.
